stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why an error occurs when the classes are compiled?

features.html:
Consider the following class definitions.
 

  • public class Point
{
   private double num1;
   private double num2;

   public Point(int n1, int n2)
   {
      num1 = n1;
      num2 = n2;
   }
}

     

  • public class PointChecker
{
   public static boolean checkPoint(Point p)
   {
      return p.num1 > 0.0 && p.num2 > 0.0;
   }
}

choicesHtml: The  Point  constructor should have return type  void.
In the  Point  constructor,  int  values cannot be assigned to  double  variables.
The  checkPoint  method cannot have a parameter of type  Point.
In the  checkPoint  method, the instance variables  num1  and  num2  cannot be accessed from a class other than  Point.
